issues: Repetitive phrasing in descriptions (e.g., "This denotes the number of unique events..."). Consider rephrasing for variety and clarity.
Some sentences are overly long and complex, making them difficult to parse quickly.
Use of technical jargon without sufficient explanation for non-technical users (e.g., "typecast", "ingested", "granularity").
Inconsistent use of bolding or other emphasis to highlight key information.
suggestions: Simplify sentence structures and break down long paragraphs.
Replace technical jargon with simpler terms or provide definitions.
Employ a consistent style for emphasizing key terms and concepts.
Use more visuals (screenshots, diagrams) to illustrate complex processes.
Add a glossary of terms to define the technical language used.

issues: Significant content duplication throughout the document.
Inconsistent heading levels and formatting.
Repetitive table of contents at the end of the document.
Lack of clear transitions between sections.
The structure is not logical, with repetitive sections and content appearing multiple times.
Repetitive listing of the table of contents.
suggestions: Remove all duplicated content. Consolidate information into a single, well-organized section.
Use consistent heading levels (H1, H2, H3) to create a clear hierarchy.
Ensure each section flows logically into the next with appropriate transitions.
Eliminate redundant table of contents listings.
Group similar topics together and separate distinct concepts into separate sections.
Use bullet points or numbered lists to break up large blocks of text.

issues: While the document covers many aspects of data management, it lacks depth in certain areas.
The 'Categories' section is very brief and doesn't provide enough information about the pre-created categories.
The document assumes a certain level of prior knowledge about MoEngage.
Missing information on troubleshooting common data management issues.
The 'Actions' section could benefit from more detailed explanations and examples.
The documentation repeats itself, but doesn't offer more insight into the topic.
suggestions: Expand on the 'Categories' section with examples of common categories and their purpose.
Add a section on troubleshooting common data management problems.
Include more detailed explanations and examples for each action in the 'Actions' section.
Provide links to related documentation or external resources for further information.
Consider adding a FAQ section to address common questions.
Ensure that each topic is covered with enough details to stand on its own.

issues: Inconsistent use of terminology (e.g., sometimes 'event attribute', sometimes 'event attributes').
Inconsistent capitalization and punctuation.
The tone is generally informative, but could be more engaging.
The documentation is repetitive and disorganized.
There's a lack of focus on the user's goals and tasks.
The documentation includes the same content multiple times.
suggestions: Establish a consistent glossary of terms and adhere to it throughout the document.
Enforce consistent capitalization, punctuation, and grammar.
Adopt a more user-centered approach by focusing on the user's goals and tasks.
Review and revise the content to eliminate repetition and improve flow.
Follow a consistent style guide for formatting and writing.
Use active voice instead of passive voice where appropriate.
